summary: This document is a deed for the property located at 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York, transferring ownership from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple, Inc. The deed includes details about the property, the parties involved, and compliance with local regulations. This document contains a billing summary for property taxes owed, including outstanding charges, interest, and payment instructions. It details the total amount due, tax year charges, and property tax rates for a specific property in New York City.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is identified as the President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation, the grantor in the property transfer.

persons.name: Erika Kellerhals
persons.context: Erika Kellerhals is mentioned as the attorney representing the buyer, Maple, Inc.

connections.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein, as President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation, is involved in the sale of the property to Maple, Inc.
Erika Kellerhals represents Maple, Inc. in the property transaction.

events.title: Property Transfer
events.description: The property located at 9 East 71st Street was transferred from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple, Inc.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York, NY 10021
keyFacts: The property was sold for a nominal amount of ten dollars.
The deed includes covenants against the grantor's acts.
The document was notarized in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Erika Kellerhals is the attorney for the buyer, Maple, Inc.
The property is classified as a one-family dwelling.
Total amount due for property taxes is $173,510.58.
If paid by July 1, 2019, the total amount due would be $345,286.05, saving $1,735.11.
The estimated market value of the property is $55,931,000.
The annual property tax before abatements is $347,021.16.
The document includes instructions for online payment of property taxes.
